title: Has any country ever achieved zero inflation? - Quora

response.answer_text: You may not believe this, but in my life in USA, after the cpi data come out as increase, during our next weeks grocery shopping, I used to experience a lowered price levels for groceries I used to buy as well as the early prices used to be non volatile for long. I lived there for more than 4 years, and this phenomenon was almost like experiencing living in a zero inflation nation.

Yes indeed. In 2019 there are 20 countries with Zero or even less rate of inflation. The prominent nations among these are: Saudi Arabia--1.05%(-) Quatar--0.36%(-) UAE--1.50%, Iraq--0.27%, (-) Switzerland-0.57%, Mali--0.17%(-) Greece--0.63%, (-) Brunei-0.07% There are 12 more nations who have practically zero inflation rate in their economy.
When countries can experience recession , leading to deflation , experiencing zero inflation isn't a big deal. Try Singapore. Singapore: Inflation falls to zero in January 2018
